definition: lit. to sing a duet/fig. to collaborate with sb/also used satirically: to play second fiddle to
to sing/to call loudly/to chant
surname Shuang
two/double/pair/both/even (number)
metallic reed/spring of lock
to echo one another (idiom)
a form of theatrical double act in which one performer speaks or sings while the other, in front, pretends to be doing the speaking or singing/double reed (as in an oboe or bassoon)
to play the role of the hero (idiom)/to play the good cop
to act in collusion (idiom)
(theater) to dismantle the stage/(fig.) to pull the rug out from under sb's feet/to undermine sb's plans
to play the role of the villain (idiom)
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
to collude/to collaborate/to gang up
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to provoke
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
to act in a play/to put on a play
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
